questions.question: What is a deadlock in operating systems?
questions.explanation: Deadlock occurs when processes wait indefinitely for resources held by each other.

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm gives the shortest average waiting time?
questions.explanation: Shortest Job First (SJF) provides the shortest average waiting time.

questions.question: What is virtual memory?
questions.explanation: Virtual memory uses disk space to simulate additional RAM when physical memory is full.

questions.question: What is a race condition?
questions.explanation: Race condition occurs when multiple processes access shared data simultaneously.

questions.question: What does a semaphore control in OS?
questions.explanation: Semaphores control access to shared resources by multiple processes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the kernel in an operating system?
questions.explanation: The kernel manages core system functions like memory, processes, and hardware communication.

questions.question: What is thrashing in virtual memory systems?
questions.explanation: Thrashing occurs when the system spends more time swapping pages than executing processes.

questions.question: Which IPC mechanism is fastest for communication between processes?
questions.explanation: Shared memory is fastest as it doesn't require data copying between processes.
